ygData.subject: Re: Roving Eye Paper
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Darren, I actually don t see the same long delay lines you saw, but also I had recurrency enabled in my networks.  And also they did not evolve for more

Hey Darren, I actually don't see the same long delay lines you saw,
but also I had recurrency enabled in my networks.  And also they did
not evolve for more than 500 generations, whereas yours were evolved
for even longer.  I think most of the memory in my Go eyes was
recurrent.

I have uploaded a sample 7x7 champion network to the photos section,
called go_eye431.jpg (it's from generation 431).

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Darren" <zysyshelp@y...> wrote:
> 
> >Darren Izzard, check out the Acknowledgments section.  I put you in
> >there since you contributed to getting me thinking along these
lines
> >with your roving eye work (which is currently available in this
group
> >through the files section).
> 
> Thanks! I'm glad it was of some use!
> 
> Have you noticed anything like the delay-line memory showing up in 
> your Go networks?
> 
> --Darren
